Comments_List: knowledge of post classical Islamic theology and philosophy

-Critical thinking
-In-depth study of Fakhr ad-din ar-Razi
-Issues and variations of these issues in medieval Islamic thought
-Thoughtful translations
- Dealing with research questions that have been little studied
-Thinking about particular scholars within a greater context of intellectual history before and after the scholar's time.
It was a really good course
The course was extremely helpful. I appreciate the detail and nuance given to each subject tackled in the course.

It depends what they are interested in. If they have an interest in Islamic theology absolutely. The figure studied is highly important in Islamic intellectual history. The class is organized so that all the work a student puts in will be drawn out in class, which is satisfying and evidence of good pedagogy.
